meanings.sent1: After the bath, the cat preened its fur meticulously.
meanings.sent2: She preened in front of the mirror before the party.
meanings.sent3: The bird preened itself with such focus, it seemed like a little artist at work.

meanings.definition: To pride oneself on one's appearance
meanings.sent1: She preened with satisfaction after receiving compliments on her outfit.
meanings.sent2: He preened when he saw his reflection in the shop window.
meanings.sent3: The peacock preened proudly, showing off its vibrant feathers.
meanings.sent4: The actor preened on the red carpet, reveling in the attention.
meanings.sent5: The student preened at the top score on the test, feeling accomplished.

meanings.definition: To make oneself look attractive by dressing or grooming in a careful and elegant way.
meanings.sent1: She preened in her best dress for the special occasion.
meanings.sent2: The groom preened before the wedding ceremony, ensuring he looked his best.
meanings.sent3: The cat preened in a tuxedo for the costume party, looking quite dapper.
meanings.sent4: The flower preened in the garden, drawing the attention of all who passed by.
meanings.sent5: The peacock preened its feathers, creating a stunning display of colors.
